translated: For example: If the universal were different from the individual, it would be seen as separate from the individual.

analyzed: abhede vyakti mātram syāt vedhā ced na virodhataḥ
translated: If it were non-different, it would be just the individual. If it were different, it would be contradictory.

original: na hi saiva tatonyā cānanyā ca saṃbhavati viruddhatvādbhedābhedayoḥ /
analyzed: na hi sā eva tatas nyā ca ananyā ca saṃbhavati viruddha tvāt bheda abhedayoḥ
translated: For, it cannot be both the same and different, because difference and non-difference are contradictory.

original: yadi ca bhinnā jātiḥ sā sarvagatā vyaktiṣveva vā /
analyzed: yadi ca bhinnā jātiḥ sā sarva gatā vyaktiṣu eva vā
translated: And if the universal were different, it would be all-pervading or it would exist only in the individuals.

analyzed: na tāvat sarvagata tvam
translated: It is not all-pervading.

analyzed: antarāle n upalabdheḥ
translated: Because it is not perceived in the interval.

original: vyaktisthā cedvyaktāvutpannāyāṃ tasmindeśe prāgasatī kathaṃ tasyāmupalabhyate /
analyzed: vyakti sthā ced vyaktau utpannāyām tasmin deśe prāk asatī katham tasyām upalabhyate
translated: If it exists in the manifestation, then when the manifestation has arisen, how is it perceived in that place, which was non-existent before?

analyzed: na tāvat tatra utpadyate
translated: It does not arise there first of all.

analyzed: nityāyāḥ utpatti ayogāt
translated: Because it is eternal, arising is not possible.

analyzed: na ca vyakti antarāt āgacchati
translated: And it does not come from another manifestation.

analyzed: a mūrta tvāt
translated: Because it is incorporeal.

analyzed: tasmin ca vyakti antare nupalabdhi prasaṅgāt
translated: And because it would follow that it is not perceived in that other manifestation.

original: nacāṃśenāgatāṃśena ca tatraiva sthiteti śakyaṃ nityatvāt /
analyzed: na ca aṃśena āgata aṃśena ca tatra eva sthitā iti śakyam nitya tvāt
translated: And it cannot remain there in part, and in part not have come, because it is eternal.

analyzed: na ca anyā itra yāti amūrta tvāt
translated: And it does not go elsewhere, because it is incorporeal.

original: vyaktyantare ca pūrvamevānasthitā jātiriti punaḥpraveśe dviguṇopalabhyeta /
analyzed: vyakti antare ca pūrvam eva an asthitā jātiḥ iti punar praveśe dviguṇā upalabhyeta
translated: And the universal, not having existed in the other manifestation before, would be perceived twice if it entered again.

original: yathāhuḥ nāyāti na ca tatrāsīdati paścānna cāṃśavat //
analyzed: yathā āhuḥ na āyāti na ca tatra āsīdati paścāt na ca aṃśa vat
translated: As they say: It does not come, nor did it exist there before, nor does it go afterwards, nor is it like a part.

original: jahāti pūrvaṃ nādhāramaho vyasanasaṃtati iti ////🔽vyaktau ca vartamānāṃ yadyekasyāṃ vyaktau kārtsnyena varteta vyaktyantareṣu na syāt /
analyzed: jahāti pūrvam na ādhāram aho vyasana saṃtati iti  vyaktau ca vartamānām yadi ekasyām vyaktau kārtsnyena varteta vyakti antareṣu na syāt
translated: It abandons the previous substratum, alas! a series of calamities.🔽And if it exists in the manifestation, if it exists in its entirety in one manifestation, it would not exist in other manifestations.

original: nahyekā matī yugapadanekatra kārtsnyena varteta vyaktyantareṣu na syāt /
analyzed: nahi ekā matī yugapad anekatra kārtsnyena varteta vyakti antareṣu na syāt
translated: For one thing cannot exist in its entirety in many things simultaneously. It would not exist in other manifestations.

original: nahyekā satī yugapadanekatra kārtsnyena vartituṃ śaknoti /
analyzed: na hi ekā satī yugapad anekatra kārtsnyena vartitum śaknoti
translated: For, being one only, it cannot exist wholly in many things at the same time.

original: nacāvayavaśo vartate niravayavatvāt /🔽kathaṃ ca nānāvidhāsvatītānāgatavartamānāsu vyaktiṣvavayavaśo vṛttiḥ saṃbhāvyeta /🔽vyaktau ca vartamānehapratyayamanubhavet /
analyzed: na ca avayavaśas vartate niravayava tvāt  katham ca nānāvidhāsu atīta anāgata vartamānāsu vyaktiṣu avayavaśas vṛttiḥ saṃbhāvyeta  vyaktau ca vartamāna iha pratyayam anubhavet
translated: Nor does it exist in parts, because it is without parts.🔽And how can it be supposed to exist in parts in the various past, future, and present individuals?🔽And when it exists in an individual, one would experience the notion of presentness with regard to it.

analyzed: dhāsu atīta anāgata vartamānāsu vyaktiṣu avayavaśas vṛttiḥ saṃbhāvyeta
translated: And how can it be supposed to exist in parts in the various past, future, and present individuals?

analyzed: vyaktau ca vartamāna iha pratyayam anubhavet
translated: And when it exists in an individual, one would experience the notion of presentness with regard to it.

original: naceha gotvamiti kasyacitpratītirasti kiṃ tviyaṃ gauriti // /
analyzed: na ca iha go tvam iti kasyacid pratītiḥ asti kim tu iyam gauḥ iti
translated: And no one has the notion this is cowness; rather, [the notion is] this is a cow.

original: atha vyakterātmaiva jātirna tadādhāraṃ vastvantaramiti cet /
analyzed: atha vyakteḥ ātmā eva jātiḥ na tad ādhāram vastu antaram iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the universal itself is the nature of the individual, not a separate entity that supports it,

analyzed: na evam yuktam
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: kathaṃ hi nānābhūtānāmanityanāṃ vyāvṛttasvabhāvānāmekarūpā nityānuvṛttasvabhāvā ca jātirātmā syāt trailokyasaṃkaraprasaṅgāt ////
analyzed: katham hi nānā bhūtānām anityanām vyāvṛtta svabhāvānām eka rūpā nitya anuvṛtta svabhāvā ca jātiḥ ātmā syāt trailokya saṃkara prasaṅgāt
translated: For how could the universal be the nature of things that are diverse, impermanent, and of distinct natures, being itself of one form, permanent, and continuous? For then there would be a confusion of the three worlds.

analyzed: na ca pramāṇam api kiñcid ākṛti sadbhāve saṃbhavati
translated: And no proof whatsoever is possible for the existence of the universal.

analyzed: na tāvat pratyakṣam
translated: Not perception.

original: na hi jātiḥ svaviṣayaṃ jñānaṃ janayati nityatvābhyupagamāt /
analyzed: na hi jātiḥ sva viṣayam jñānam janayati nitya tva abhyupagamāt
translated: For a universal does not produce cognition of itself, because it is held to be eternal.

analyzed: nityānām ca sarva arthakriyāsu asāmarthyāt
translated: And eternals are incapable of any action.

original: na hi jātiḥ svaviṣayaṃ jñānaṃ janayati nityatvābhyupagamāt /
analyzed: na hi jātiḥ sva viṣayam jñānam janayati nitya tva abhyupagamāt
translated: For a universal does not produce cognition of itself, because it is held to be eternal.

analyzed: nityānām ca sarva arthakriyāsu asāmarthyāt
translated: And eternals are incapable of any action.

analyzed: na ca ajanakasya viṣaya tvam saṃbhavati tad lakṣaṇa tvāt viṣaya tvasya
translated: And for that which does not produce, there cannot be the state of being an object, because being an object is the definition of that [object].

original: tasmadvikalpākāramātraṃ sāmānyam / alīkaṃ vā ////🔽nanu yathā jñānavaicitryopapatteḥ ////
analyzed: tasmat vikalpa ākāra mātram sāmānyam alīkam vā  nanu yathā jñāna vaicitrya upapatteḥ
translated: Therefore, the universal is merely the form of an option, or it is false.

analyzed: artha śūnyāḥ api vikalpāḥ vicitra artha kriyā samartha sva lakṣaṇa abhimāninaḥ jāyamānāḥ tatra
translated: But how is it that, even though devoid of an object, options arise with the conceit of a particular capable of various effects,

original: vyavahārārthinaṃ pravartayantaḥ paramparayā tatprabhavatayā tatprāpayanto maṇimiva
analyzed: vyavahāra arthinam pravartayantaḥ paramparayā tad prabhava tayā tat prāpayantaḥ maṇim iva
translated: and, causing one who desires activity to engage in that [activity], ultimately bring about that [object] through their origination, like a gem,

analyzed: maṇi prabhā viṣaya maṇi buddhiḥ vyavahāra avisaṃvādinaḥ bhavanti iti na lokayātrā sthiteḥ kaścid virodhaḥ
translated: and, being in agreement with activity, become the cognition of a gem with respect to the appearance of a gem, so there is no contradiction with the established course of the world?

analyzed: tasmāt na asti jātiḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no such thing as a universal.

analyzed: etena avayavi dravyam pratyūḍham
translated: By this [argument], extended substances are refuted.

analyzed: tasya api avayava bheda ādi vikalpa akṣama tvāt
translated: Because it cannot be imagined as having parts, etc.

analyzed: sthūla avabhāsaḥ tu saṃcita aneka rūpa ādi paramāṇu vaśāt eva keśoṇḍrka avabhāsa vat upapannaḥ na avayavi kalpanāya alam
translated: The appearance of grossness is possible only due to the atoms of many combined forms, etc., like the appearance of a hair-net, and is not sufficient to postulate a whole.

analyzed: tad abhāve ca nirādhāra tvāt dūra apāstam go tva ādi sāmānyam
translated: And in the absence of that, the universal such as cowness, which is without a substratum, is far removed.

analyzed: katham asati eka rūpe sāmānye tyanta vilakṣaṇāni sva lakṣaṇāni avilakṣaṇa rūpam vikalpam janayanti
translated: How do the absolutely dissimilar individual characteristics produce a conceptual cognition with an undifferentiated form, when there is no single universal?

original: janayanti cet kimiti kānicideva govikalpaṃ janayanti kānicidevāśvavikalpam /
analyzed: janayanti ced kim iti kānicid eva go vikalpam janayanti kānicid eva aśva vikalpam
translated: If they do produce it, then why do they produce the conceptual cognition of only some cows and not all, and why do they produce the conceptual cognition of only some horses and not all?

analyzed: narvāṇi sarvam
translated: Not all.

original: sāmānyavādino vā kathaṃ vilakṣaṇarūpā vyaktayo vilakṣaṇasāmānyātmakatvaṃ tadāśrayatvaṃ tadabhivyañjakatvaṃ vā bhajante /
analyzed: sāmānyavādinaḥ vā katham vilakṣaṇa rūpāḥ vyaktayaḥ vilakṣaṇa sāmānya ātmaka tvam tad āśraya tvam tad abhivyañjaka tvam vā bhajante
translated: Or how do the individual things with dissimilar forms come to possess the nature of a dissimilar universal, to be the substratum of that, or to manifest that, according to the proponents of universals?

original: bhajanticetkimiti kāścideva vyaktayaḥ kenacideva sāmānyena saṃbadhyante na sarvāḥ sarvaiḥ /
analyzed: bhajanti ced kim iti kāścid eva vyaktayaḥ kenacid eva sāmānyena saṃbadhyante na sarvāḥ sarvaiḥ
translated: If they do possess it, then why are only certain individual things connected with a certain universal and not all with all?

analyzed: svabhāvāt iti ced
translated: If it is said to be due to their nature,

analyzed: asmākam api tulyam idam uttaram
translated: then this answer is the same for us also.

analyzed: sva matena jāti sthāpanam
translated: Establishing the universal according to one's own view.

analyzed: atha vyaktīnām api avilakṣaṇa rūpa sāmānya saṃbandha siddhi artham param avilakṣaṇa rūpam abhyupagamyate tatas tena api saṃbandha siddhi artham apara aparā sāmānya apekṣayām anavasthā  /
translated: If, in order to establish the connection of the individuals with a universal having an undifferentiated form, a still more undifferentiated form is admitted, then, in order to establish the connection with that also, another and still more undifferentiated universal will have to be assumed; and thus there will be an infinite regress.

analyzed: syāt
translated: If, on the other hand, a supremely different form is accepted in order to establish the connection of individuals with a general form that is not different, then due to the dependence on other and other universals for the establishment of that connection, there would be an infinite regress.

analyzed: tasmāt vikalpa mātram eva idam
translated: Therefore, this is mere option.

original: na paramārthataḥ sāmānyaṃ nāma kiñcit ////🔽atrābhidhīyate pratyakṣabalasiddhasya sāmānyasya kutarkataḥ //
analyzed: na paramārthataḥ sāmānyam nāma kiñcid  atra abhidhīyate pratyakṣa bala siddhasya sāmānyasya kutarkataḥ
translated: In reality, there is no such thing as a universal at all.🔽To this we reply: The universal, established by the power of perception, cannot be denied by fallacious reasoning.

original: na śakyo 'pahnavaḥ kartuṃ sarvaṃ vijayate hi tat //
analyzed: na śakyaḥ u pahnavaḥ kartum sarvam vijayate hi tat
translated: Everything is indeed victorious.

analyzed: sarveṣu api vastuṣu iyam api gauḥ iyam api gauḥ
translated: In all things, this is a cow, that is a cow.

analyzed: ayam api vṛkṣaḥ yam api iti vyāvṛtta anuvṛtta ākāram pratyakṣam deśa kāla avasthā antareṣu aviparyastam udīyamānam
translated: This is a tree, that is a tree. The perception with the form of exclusion and inclusion, not contradicted in different places, times and conditions,

original: sarvameva tarkābhāsaṃ vijitya dvyākāraṃ vastu vyavasthāpayat kenānyena śakyate bādhitum /
analyzed: sarvam eva tarka ābhāsam vijitya dvi ākāram vastu vyavasthāpayat kena anyena śakyate bādhitum
translated: arising, having conquered all fallacious reasoning, establishes the entity with two forms. By what other [means of knowledge] can it be contradicted?

analyzed: na hi tatas pramāṇam
translated: For there is no stronger means of knowledge than that.

analyzed: tad mūla tvāt pramāṇa antarāṇām tad bādha sāmarthya abhāvāt
translated: Because other means of knowledge have that [perception] as their root, and because they are incapable of contradicting it.

original: kiñcānumānānyapi sāmānyāpekṣatvātsutarāṃ sāmānyaṃ samarthayante na tu bādhituṃ śaknuvanti /
analyzed: kiñca anumānāni api sāmānya apekṣa tvāt sutarām sāmānyam samarthayante na tu bādhitum śaknuvanti
translated: Moreover, the inferences, because they depend on universals, clearly establish the universal, and cannot contradict it.

analyzed: nahi yadi apekṣam tat tasya bādham
translated: For that which depends on something cannot

analyzed: śaknoti kartum
translated: contradict it.

original: tadbādhe hi svātmāpi na siddhyet tadapekṣatvāt ////🔽tathāhi bhedābhedavikalpena sāmānyaṃ nirākurvatāvaśyamevaṃ vaktavyam yadvastu tadbhinnamabhinnaṃ
analyzed: tad bādhe hi sva ātmā api na siddhyet tad apekṣa tvāt  tathā hi bheda abheda vikalpena sāmānyam nirākurvatā avaśyam evam vaktavyam yat vastu tat bhinnam abhinnam
translated: For if it were contradicted, its own self would not be established, because it depends on that.

original: vā bhavati sāmānyamapi yadi vastu syāttato 'nenāpi bhinnenābhinnena vā bhavitavyam /
analyzed: vā bhavati sāmānyam api yadi vastu syāt tatas nena api bhinnena abhinnena vā bhavitavyam
translated: Thus, one who denies the universal by the alternative of difference and non-difference must necessarily say this: Whatever is a real entity, that is either different or non-different. If the universal were also a real entity, then it too would have to be either different or non-different.

original: na ca dvedhāpi saṃbhavati tasmādavastu iti /
analyzed: na ca dvedhā api saṃbhavati tasmāt avastu iti
translated: And it is not possible in either way. Therefore it is not a real entity.

analyzed: evam ca vadatā vastu tvam sāmānyam aṅgīkāryam
translated: And by saying this, the universal must be accepted as a real entity.

original: anyathā kathaṃ vastutvasya🔽bhedābhedābhyāṃ vyāptatvādvyāpakānupalabdhyā sāmānyasya vastutvaṃ na saṃbhavatīti bhaṇituṃ śakyam // /
analyzed: anyathā katham vastu tvasya  bheda abhedābhyām vyāpta tvāt vyāpaka anupalabdhyā sāmānyasya vastu tvam na saṃbhavati iti bhaṇitum śakyam
translated: Otherwise, how can the pervasion of being a real entity🔽by difference and non-difference be stated, so that it can be said that the existence of the universal as a real entity is not possible due to the non-apprehension of the pervader?

analyzed: nanu aulapa adhikaḥ vastu śabdaḥ na jāti nimittakaḥ tat katham anena jāti āpattiḥ
translated: But the word real entity is based on substance, not on the universal. How then is the universal implied by this?

analyzed: ucyate jātiḥ vā bhavatu upādhiḥ vā sarvathā tāvat sāmānya rūpam apekṣitavyam
translated: It is said that either the universal or the property may be the limiting adjunct. In any case, a universal form must be accepted.

analyzed: aupādhikānām api mūla upalakṣaṇam ekam antareṇa ātmalābha abhāvāt
translated: Even for those based on limiting adjuncts, without a single basic characteristic, there can be no attainment of self-existence.

original: na ca vyāvṛttaikarasaṃ sarvaṃ vastujāmamabhyupagacchataḥ saugatasya kvacidapi kiñcidapyanuvṛttaṃ rūpaṃ saṃbhavatītyaupādhiko vyavahāro durghaṭa
analyzed: na ca vyāvṛtta eka rasam sarvam vastu jāmam abhyupagacchataḥ saugatasya kvacid api kiñcid api anuvṛttam rūpam saṃbhavati iti aupādhikaḥ vyavahāraḥ durghaṭa
translated: And for the Buddhist who accepts all things as having a nature consisting solely of exclusions, no form at all can be present anywhere. Thus, a transactional usage based on limiting adjuncts is difficult to establish.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva pramāṇa siddham sāmānyam na śakyam apahnotum
translated: Therefore, the universal, which is established by all means of valid knowledge, cannot be denied.

analyzed: kaḥ punar vikalpānām parihāraḥ
translated: What, then, is the solution to the alternatives?

analyzed: na tāvat a parihṛtāḥ api śaknuvanti sāmānyam apahnotum
translated: As long as they are not resolved, they cannot deny the universal.

analyzed: teṣām api tad apekṣa tvāt iti uktam tathā api parihāraḥ abhidhīyate
translated: Even so, the solution is stated.

analyzed: jāti vyaktyoḥ bheda abheda vicāraḥ
translated: The discussion of the difference and non-difference of the universal and the individual.

analyzed: bheda abheda vikalpe tāvat kecid āhuḥ bhinnam eva sāmānyam vyaktibhyaḥ
translated: In the consideration of difference and non-difference, some say that the universal is indeed different from the individuals.

analyzed: na ca pṛthak upalabdhi prasaṅgaḥ vyakti saṃbandhi tvāt
translated: And there is no consequence of separate perception, because it is related to the individuals.🔽What, then, is the relation? Inherence.

analyzed: kaḥ punar saṃbandhaḥ samavāyaḥ 🔽kaḥ punar asau
translated: What, then, is that?

analyzed: ayuta siddhānām ihapratyaya hetuḥ saṃbandhaḥ iti kecid
translated: Some say that the relation is the cause of the cognition of inherence between things that are not simultaneously produced.

analyzed: tattva yuktam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: ihapratyaya asiddheḥ
translated: Because the cognition of inherence is not established.

original: iyaṃ gauriti hi sarvadā sarveṣāṃ pratītirnehagotvamiti /
analyzed: iyam gauḥ iti hi sarvadā sarveṣām pratītiḥ na iha go tvam iti
translated: For everyone always has the cognition this is a cow, not this is the cowness.

analyzed: kācā iyam ayuta siddhiḥ
translated: What is this non-simultaneous production?

analyzed: yuta siddhi abhāvaḥ
translated: It is the absence of simultaneous production.

analyzed: kā punar yuta siddhiḥ
translated: And what is simultaneous production?

analyzed: pṛthak gatimatvam pṛthak āśraya āśrita tvam vā
translated: It is the quality of having separate motion or the quality of being based on separate substrates.

analyzed: tad abhāvaḥ yuta siddhiḥ
translated: The absence of that is non-simultaneous production.

analyzed: yadi evam avayava avayavinoḥ saṃbandhaḥ samavāyaḥ na syāt
translated: If that is so, then there would be no inherence relation between parts and whole,

analyzed: vinā api avayavi calanena avayavānām calanāt
translated: because the parts move even without the movement of the whole.

analyzed: avayavinaḥ vayavānām ca sva avayava āśraya tvāt
translated: Because the whole and the parts are based on their own parts.

original: tathā sāmānyasya vyaktyāśrayatvāt vyakteśca svāvayavāśritatvādasti pṛthagāśrayāśrayitvamiti samavāyānupapattiḥ /
analyzed: tathā sāmānyasya vyakti āśraya tvāt vyakteḥ ca sva avayava āśrita tvāt asti pṛthak āśraya āśrayi tvam iti samavāya anupapattiḥ
translated: Similarly, because the universal is based on the individual and the individual is based on its own parts, there is a relation of being based on separate substrates, so inherence is not possible.

original: tasmādevaṃ vaktavyam yena saṃbandhenādheyamādhāre svānurūpāṃ buddhiṃ janayati /
analyzed: tasmāt evam vaktavyam yena saṃbandhena ādheyam ādhāre sva anurūpām buddhim janayati
translated: Therefore, it should be stated thus: That relation by which the object to be based produces a cognition in accordance with itself in the substrate,

analyzed: sva ākāreṇa bodhayati iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that it makes it known in its own form.

analyzed: sa saṃbandhaḥ samavāyaḥ iti
translated: That relation is inherence.

original: yadi jātyātmanā vyaktiḥ pratīyate tato jātivyaktyorabheda eva pratītibalādāpadyate kathaṃ bhedābhyupagamaḥ /
analyzed: yadi jāti ātmanā vyaktiḥ pratīyate tatas jāti vyaktyoḥ abhedaḥ eva pratīti balāt āpadyate katham bheda abhyupagamaḥ
translated: If the individual is perceived as having the nature of the universal, then the non-difference of the universal and the individual is established by the force of perception itself. How can their difference be accepted?

original: ucyate gaurayaṃ śāvaleyo gaurayaṃ bāhuleya ityubhayatra gavākāro 'nuvartamāno dṛśyate /
analyzed: ucyate gauḥ ayam śāvaleyaḥ gauḥ ayam bāhuleyaḥ iti ubhayatra gavākāraḥ nuvartamānaḥ dṛśyate
translated: It is said: This is a cow, this is a cow. In both cases, the form of the cow is seen to continue.

analyzed: śāvaleya bāhuleya ākārau tu vyāvartete
translated: But the forms of the Śābaleya and Bāhuleya cows are excluded.

analyzed: tadī api tayoḥ śābaleya gavākārayoḥ abhedaḥ syāt eka anuvṛttau itaraḥ u pi anuvarteta
translated: Even if there were non-difference between those two, the form of the Śābaleya cow and the cow, the other would also continue.

analyzed: tad vyāvṛttau vā vyāvarteta
translated: Or, if that is excluded, the form of the cow would also be excluded.

original: kiṃ ca tasyāmeva vyaktāviyaṃ gauriti gavātmanā pratīyamānāyāmapi neyaṃbuddhigobuddhyorgaurirgauritivatparyāyatvaṃ pratīyate tasmānnābhedaḥ
analyzed: kim ca tasyām eva vyaktau iyam gauḥ iti go ātmanā pratīyamānāyām api na iyam buddhi go buddhyoḥ gauriḥ gauḥ iti vat paryāya tvam pratīyate tasmāt na abhedaḥ
translated: Moreover, even when that very individual is perceived as having the nature of the cow, as this is a cow, the cognition of this and the cognition of the cow are not perceived as synonyms like the cow is a cow. Therefore, there is no non-difference.

analyzed: katham tarhi tādrūpyam vyakteḥ pratīyate
translated: Then how is the similarity of the individual perceived?

original: idameva hi tādrūpyaṃ vyakteryat tat samavāyaḥ saṃbandhaḥ /
analyzed: idam eva hi tādrūpyam vyakteḥ yat tat samavāyaḥ saṃbandhaḥ
translated: This itself is the similarity of the individual, namely that which is inherence, the relation.

analyzed: tasya eṣa mahimā yena ādhāram ādheyam sva buddhyā anurañjayati tasmāt adoṣaḥ
translated: This is its greatness, by which it delights the substratum and the superstratum with its own cognition. Therefore, there is no fault.

analyzed: athavā tādātmya pratīteḥ abhedaḥ upi astu
translated: Or rather, let there be non-difference due to the perception of identity.

analyzed: pūrva ukta nyāyena bhedaḥ pi
translated: And difference also, for the reasons stated above.

analyzed: tasmāt pramāṇa balena bhinna abhinna tvam eva yuktam
translated: Therefore, it is proper to accept difference and non-difference as established by the force of the means of knowledge.

original: nanu viruddhau bhedābhedau kathamekatra syātāṃ na virodhaḥ sahadarśanāt /
analyzed: nanu viruddhau bheda abhedau katham ekatra syātām na virodhaḥ saha darśanāt
translated: But how can difference and non-difference, which are contradictory, exist in one thing? There is no contradiction, because they are seen together.

original: yadi hi idaṃ rajataṃ nedaṃ rajatamitivatparasparopamardena bhedābhedau pratīyeyātāṃ tato viruddhyeyātāṃ /🔽na tu tayoḥ parasparopamardena pratītiḥ iyaṃ gauritibuddhidvayamaparyāyeṇa pratibhāsamānamekaṃ
analyzed: yadi hi idam rajatam na idam rajatam iti vat paraspara upamardena bheda abhedau pratīyeyātām tatas viruddhyeyātām  na tu tayoḥ paraspara upamardena pratītiḥ iyam gauḥ iti buddhi dvayam aparyāyeṇa pratibhāsamānam ekam
translated: For if difference and non-difference were to be apprehended by mutual exclusion, like this is silver and this is not silver, then they would be contradictory.🔽But they are not apprehended by mutual exclusion. The two cognitions this is a cow appearing successively establish a single entity with a dual nature.

original: vastu dvyātmakaṃ vyavasthāpayati sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ hyabhedamāpādayati aparyāyatvaṃ ca bhedam /
analyzed: vastu dvi ātmakam vyavasthāpayati sāmānādhikaraṇyam hi abhedam āpādayati aparyāya tvam ca bhedam
translated: For the co-reference of words establishes non-difference, and the use of different words establishes difference.

analyzed: atas pratīti balāt avirodhaḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction due to the force of cognition.

analyzed: apekṣā bhedāt ca
translated: And also due to the difference of relation.

original: tathāhi gorūpeṇa nirūpyamāṇayā jātyā vyaktirabhedena pratīyate gaurayaṃ śābaleya iti /
analyzed: tathā hi go rūpeṇa nirūpyamāṇayā jātyā vyaktiḥ abhedena pratīyate gauḥ ayam śābaleyaḥ iti
translated: For when a class is being determined by the form of a cow, an individual is apprehended as non-different, as in this is a cow, a brindled one.

original: yadā tu jātirvayaktyantarātmanā nirūpyate tadeyaṃ vyaktisato bhinnarūpāvasīyate yo 'sau bāhuleya gauḥ so 'yaṃ śābaleyo na bhavatīti /
analyzed: yadā tu jātiḥ vayakti antara ātmanā nirūpyate tadā iyam vyakti sataḥ bhinna rūpā avasīyate saḥ sau bāhuleya gauḥ saḥ yam śābaleyaḥ na bhavati iti
translated: But when the universal is determined as having the nature of another individual, then this individual is ascertained to have a different form, that the cow which is the Bahuleya is not the Shabaleya.

analyzed: evam dharmiṇaḥ dravyasya
translated: Thus, of the substance which is the substratum,

analyzed: rasa ādi dharma antara rūpeṇa rūpa ādibhyām bhedaḥ dravya rūpeṇa ca abhedaḥ
translated: the difference from the other attributes such as taste etc. is by means of form etc., and the non-difference by means of the form of substance.

analyzed: tathā avayavinaḥ sva rūpeṇa avayavaiḥ abhedaḥ vayava antara rūpeṇa tu avayava antaraiḥ bhedaḥ iti ūhanīyam
translated: Similarly, of the whole, the non-difference from the parts by its own form, but the difference from the other parts by the form of the other parts, should be understood.

original: tatra yathā dīrghahrasvādīnāṃ viruddhasvabhāvāmāmapyapekṣābhedādekatrāpyaviruddhaṃ pratītibalādaṅgīkriyate tathā bhedābhedayorapi draṣyavyaṃ
analyzed: tatra yathā dīrgha hrasva ādīnām viruddha svabhāvāmām api apekṣā bhedāt ekatra api aviruddham pratīti balāt aṅgīkriyate tathā bheda abhedayoḥ api draṣyavyam
translated: There, just as the long, short etc. are of contradictory nature, yet due to the difference in dependence, they are accepted as non-contradictory in one place by the power of cognition, so should it be seen in the case of difference and non-difference also.

analyzed: pratīti aviśeṣāt
translated: Because of the non-difference in cognition.
In the Prabhakara view, the objection is that difference and non-difference are not co-extensive.

original: kaścitpunarāha pratītireva bhedābhedabhāsinī na saṃbhavatīti vilakṣaṇarūpā pratītirhi bhedāvabhāsaḥ tadyena bhedapratibhāsasamaye jātirūpaṃ
analyzed: kaścid punar āha pratītiḥ eva bheda abheda bhāsinī na saṃbhavati iti vilakṣaṇa rūpā pratītiḥ hi bheda avabhāsaḥ tat yena bheda pratibhāsa samaye jāti rūpam
translated: But someone else says that the cognition itself which appears as different and non-different is not possible. For a cognition of a different form is the appearance of difference. At the time of the appearance of difference, the form of the universal

analyzed: vyakti rūpam ca pratītam
translated: and the form of the individual are cognized.

analyzed: tena abheda pratīti velāyām tayoḥ anyatarat pratyetavyam
translated: Therefore, at the time of the cognition of non-difference, one of them must be cognized.

analyzed: tatra ekasya dvis avabhāsaḥ yam bhavet
translated: In that case, this would be the appearance of one as two.

analyzed: na punar itareṇa abhedaḥ pratītaḥ bhavati
translated: But the other is not cognized as non-different.

analyzed: tasmāt na asti bheda abhedayoḥ ekatra pratītiḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no cognition of difference and non-difference in one thing.

analyzed: tat idam asāram
translated: This is not correct.

analyzed: na hi vastu dvaya pratītiḥ eva bheda pratītiḥ tad bhāve pi abhāvāt
translated: For the cognition of two things is not the cognition of difference, because it does not exist even when that exists.

original: prathamaṃ vyaktidarśane 'pi hyasti jātivyaktyordvayoḥ pratītirnaca tadā tayorbhedaḥ
analyzed: prathamam vyakti darśane hi asti jāti vyaktyoḥ dvayoḥ pratītiḥ na ca tadā tayoḥ bhedaḥ
translated: Even at the first sight of the individual, there is the cognition of both the universal and the individual, but at that time their difference is not cognized.

analyzed: pratīyate vyakti antara darśanena tu jāteḥ anvayāt pūrva vyakteḥ ca vyatirekāt anvaya vyatirekābhyām
translated: But by seeing another individual, from the concomitance of the universal and the disjunction from the previous individual, by the concomitance and disjunction,

analyzed: jāti vyaktyoḥ bhedaḥ vadhāryate iti siddhāntaḥ
translated: the difference of the universal and the individual is ascertained. This is also your established doctrine.

original: tathā devadattamupalabhya kālāntare tatsadṛśaṃ yajñadattaṃ dūrātpaśyan pūrvopalabdhaṃ
analyzed: tathā devadattam upalabhya kāla antare tad sadṛśam yajñadattam dūrāt paśyan pūrva upalabdham
translated: Similarly, having perceived Devadatta, later seeing Yajnadatta, who is similar to him, from a distance, and remembering Devadatta who was perceived earlier,

original: ca devadattaṃ smaran vastutastadvilakṣaṇameva puruṣagadvayaṃ pratyeti tathāpi na
analyzed: ca devadattam smaran vastutas tad vilakṣaṇam eva puruṣa ga dvayam pratyeti tathā api na
translated: although he actually cognizes the two men as different, he does not

original: bhedamavadhārayati saṃśete hi kiṃ sa evāyaṃ devadattaḥ kiṃ vānya iti /
analyzed: bhedam avadhārayati saṃśete hi kim saḥ eva ayam devadattaḥ kim vā anyaḥ iti
translated: For one doubts, thinking Is this the same Devadatta or is it another?

analyzed: tasmāt vastu dvaya pratītiḥ eva beda pratītiḥ iti uktam
translated: Therefore, it is said that the cognition of two things itself is the cognition of difference.

original: tathā tameva devadattaṃ kiṃ vānyaḥ iti /
analyzed: tathā tam eva devadattam kim vā anyaḥ iti
translated: Similarly, regarding that very Devadatta, one doubts, thinking Is this the same or another?

analyzed: tasmāt vastu dvaya pratītiḥ eva bheda pratītiḥ iti uktam
translated: Therefore, it is said that the cognition of two things itself is the cognition of difference.

original: tathā tameva devadattaṃ kālāntare dūrātpaśyannapi kiṃ sa evāyamutānya iti /
analyzed: tathā tam eva devadattam kāla antare dūrāt paśyan api kim saḥ eva ayam uta anyaḥ iti
translated: Similarly, even when seeing the same Devadatta at a later time from a distance, one doubts, thinking Is this the same or another?

analyzed: saṃdihānaḥ vastu gatyā ekam eva pratiyan api na abhedam avadhārayayitum alam bhavati
translated: Even while cognizing the same object, one is unable to ascertain non-difference.

analyzed: tasmāt na vastu dvaya pratītiḥ eva bheda pratītiḥ
translated: Therefore, the cognition of two things is not the cognition of difference.

analyzed: na api eka vastu pratītiḥ eva abheda pratītiḥ
translated: Nor is the cognition of one thing the cognition of non-difference.

original: kintvanyo 'yamiti buddhirbhedāvabhāsaḥ ananyo 'yamiti cābhedāvabhāsaḥ /🔽asti ca śābaleyabāhuleyāvupalabhyamānasya ayaṃ
analyzed: kintu anyaḥ yam iti buddhiḥ bheda avabhāsaḥ ananyaḥ yam iti ca abheda avabhāsaḥ  asti ca śābaleya bāhuleyau upalabhyamānasya ayam
translated: Rather, the cognition This is different is the appearance of difference, and the cognition This is not different is the appearance of non-difference.

analyzed: gauḥ ayam iti gauḥ iti abheda avabhāsaḥ
translated: And there is the appearance of non-difference in the case of one who perceives the Śābaleya and Bāhuleya, thinking This cow is the same as that cow.

analyzed: anyaḥ śābaleyāt bāhuleyaḥ iti ca bheda avabhāsaḥ
translated: And there is the appearance of difference in the thought The Bāhuleya is different from the Śābaleya.

analyzed: tasmāt upapannam bhinna abhinna tvam
translated: Therefore, the state of being different and non-different is established.

analyzed: nanu anuvṛttā nitya anutpatti vināśa dharmā ca jātiḥ
translated: Is not the universal eternal, having the nature of non-origination and non-destruction?

analyzed: viparīta svabhāvā ca vyaktiḥ
translated: But the universal is eternal, having the nature of non-production and non-destruction, while the individual has an opposite nature.

analyzed: katham tayoḥ aikyam
translated: How can there be identity between them?

original: nahyekameva vastvanuvṛttaṃ vyāvṛttaṃ nityamanityamutpattivināśadharmakamataddharmakaṃ ca saṃbhavati trailokyasaṃkaraprasaṅgāt /🔽jātirapyevamanityatvādidharmā syāt /
analyzed: nahi ekam eva vastu anuvṛttam vyāvṛttam nityam anityam utpatti vināśa dharmakam a tad dharmakam ca saṃbhavati trailokya saṃkara prasaṅgāt  jātiḥ api evam anitya tva ādi dharmā syāt
translated: For it is not possible for a single entity to be both universal and particular, eternal and non-eternal, having the nature of production and destruction, and not having that nature, because that would lead to the confusion of the three worlds.🔽The universal would also have the properties of non-eternality, etc.,

analyzed: vyaktiḥ api nitya tva ādi dharmā
translated: and the individual would have the properties of eternality, etc.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: nānākāraṃ hi tadvastu kenacidākāreṇa nityatvādikaṃ kenaciccānityatvādikaṃ bibhranna virotsyate /
analyzed: nānā ākāram hi tat vastu kenacid ākāreṇa nitya tva ādikam kenacid ca anitya tva ādikam bibhrat na virotsyate
translated: For that entity, which has many forms, will not be contradictory if it bears eternality, etc. in one form and non-eternality, etc. in another.

original: jātirapi vyaktirūpeṇānityā vyaktirapi jātyātmanā nityeti nātra kācidaniṣṭāpattiḥ //
analyzed: jātiḥ api vyakti rūpeṇa anityā vyaktiḥ api jāti ātmanā nityā iti na atra kācid aniṣṭa āpattiḥ
translated: The universal is also non-eternal in the form of the individual, and the individual is eternal in the form of the universal. Thus there is no undesirable consequence here at all.

analyzed: jāteḥ sarvagata tva ādi ākṣepa tad parihārau
translated: The objection and its answer regarding the omnipresence of the universal.

original: yattu sarvagatā vyaktigatā vā jātiriti vikalpitaṃ /
analyzed: yat tu sarva gatā vyakti gatā vā jātiḥ iti vikalpitam
translated: As for the option considered - whether the universal is omnipresent or resides in the individual -

analyzed: tat api vyakti ātma tva abhidhānāt eva parihṛtam
translated: that too is refuted simply by the statement that it has the nature of the individual.

analyzed: vyakteḥ hi asau ātmā katham anyatra syāt
translated: For how can that be the self of the individual if it exists elsewhere?

original: nanvevaṃ vyaktideśe vyaktyutpatteḥ prāgavidyamānā jātiḥ kathaṃ tatra paścādbhavati /
analyzed: nanu evam vyakti deśe vyakti utpatteḥ prāk avidyamānā jātiḥ katham tatra paścāt bhavati
translated: But how can a universal, which does not exist in the place of the individual prior to the production of the individual, come to exist there later?

analyzed: sva kāraṇāt niṣpadyamānā vyaktiḥ jāti viśeṣa ātmanā saṃbaddhā eva utpadyate nitya tvāt
translated: The individual, which is produced from its own causes, is produced as connected with the nature of a particular universal, because of its eternality.

analyzed: na ca anyatra āgacchati amūrta tvāt
translated: And it does not come from elsewhere, because it is incorporeal.

original: ucyate yo 'pi deśāntarādāgatyānena deśena saṃyujyate so 'pi prāgasmindeśe 'vidyamāna eva kathamanena deśena saṃyogamanubhavati kāraṇavaśāditi
analyzed: ucyate yaḥ pi deśa antarāt āgatya anena deśena saṃyujyate saḥ u pi prāk asmin deśe vidyamānaḥ eva katham anena deśena saṃyogam anubhavati kāraṇa vaśāt iti
translated: It is said: Even one who comes from another place and becomes connected with this place, he too, not existing in this place before, how does he experience connection with this place? Because of the power of the cause.

analyzed: evam jātiḥ api kāraṇa vaśāt eva vyakti saṃbandham anubhavati
translated: In the same way, a universal also experiences connection with an individual only because of the power of the cause.

original: iyāstu viśeṣaḥ saṃyujyamānaḥ pūrvatrāvasthito 'nantaradeśena prathamaṃ saṃyujyate tatastadanantaradeśeneti krameṇa deśāntaralasaṃyogaṃ gacchati
analyzed: iyāḥ tu viśeṣaḥ saṃyujyamānaḥ pūrvatra avasthitaḥ nantara deśena prathamam saṃyujyate tatas tad anantara deśena iti krameṇa deśa antara la saṃyogam gacchati
translated: This is the difference: What is being connected, first remains in the previous place and becomes connected with the next place, then with the place after that, and in this way goes to connection with another place in sequence.

analyzed: tādātmya samavāyayoḥ tu anantara deśam an apekṣya eva sva kāraṇataḥ niṣpattiḥ
translated: But the inherence of identity, without regard to the next place, is produced from its own cause.

original: na hi saṃyogasya svabhāvaḥ sa eva tādātmyasya samavāyasya vāṅgīkartavyaḥ /
analyzed: na hi saṃyogasya svabhāvaḥ saḥ eva tādātmyasya samavāyasya vā aṅgīkartavyaḥ
translated: For that very nature of conjunction cannot be accepted as that of identity or inherence.

analyzed: pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no evidence.

analyzed: vilakṣaṇa svabhāva tvāt bhāvānām
translated: Because of the dissimilarity of the natures of things.

analyzed: tasmāt adoṣaḥ
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

analyzed: yat vāstu sarva gatam sāmānyam
translated: Or rather, if the universal is all-pervading,

analyzed: na ca sarvatra upalabdhi prasaṅgaḥ vyaktīnām abhivyañjaka tvāt
translated: and there is no possibility of its being perceived everywhere, because the individuals manifest it.

analyzed: sarva gatam api sāmānyam vyakteḥ eva ātmā tad samavetam vā
translated: Even though the universal is all-pervading, it is the very self of the individual or inheres in it.

analyzed: saṃyukta samavāya saṃnikarṣeṇa ca sāmānyasya upalambhaḥ
translated: And the perception of the universal is due to the conjunction of inherence in what is conjoined.

original: tena ca saṃnikarṣo vyaktideśe eva saṃbhavati nānyatreti na sarvatropalabdhiḥ /
analyzed: tena ca saṃnikarṣaḥ vyakti deśe eva saṃbhavati na anyatra iti na sarvatra upalabdhiḥ
translated: And that conjunction is possible only in the place of the individual, not elsewhere, so there is no perception everywhere.

analyzed: abhede pi jāti vyaktyoḥ bhedasya api vidyamāna tvāt nitya tvāt nitya tva ādi vat sarvagata tva āsrava gata tvam api nā anupapannam
translated: Even in the absence of difference, because the difference between the universal and the individual also exists, like eternality and so on, all-pervasiveness and non-pervasiveness are also not impossible.

original: yattu kārtsnyena vā avayavaśo vā vṛttiriti vikalpitam /
analyzed: yat tu kārtsnyena vā avayavaśas vā vṛttiḥ iti vikalpitam
translated: As for the option that it pervades either wholly or partially,

analyzed: tat api ayuktam
translated: that too is not correct.

original: bhedāpekṣaṃ hi kārtsnyaṃ na ca sāmānyasya svarūpato 'vayavato vā bhedosti ekatvādanavayavatvācca /
analyzed: bheda apekṣam hi kārtsnyam na ca sāmānyasya svarūpataḥ vayavataḥ vā bhedaḥ usti ekatvāt anavayava tvāt ca
translated: For wholeness depends on difference, and the universal has no difference either in its own nature or in its parts, because it is one and has no parts.

analyzed: niravayava tvāt eva avayava vaśaḥ pi vṛttiḥ abhāvyā eva
translated: And because it has no parts, partial pervasion is also impossible.

original: tasmādvyaktiṣu jātirvartata ityetāvadevātra vaktuṃ śakyate pramāṇato 'vagamāt /
analyzed: tasmāt vyaktiṣu jātiḥ vartate iti etāvat eva atra vaktum śakyate pramāṇataḥ vagamāt
translated: Therefore, it can only be said here that the universal exists in the individuals, to that extent, because it is understood through valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: na kārtsnya bhāga vibhāgaḥ pramāṇa abhāvāt asaṃbhāvāt ca
translated: The distinction of entirety and part is not possible, because there is no valid means of knowledge and because it is impossible.

original: tathāvayavino 'pyavayaveṣu na kārtsnyaṃ saṃbhavati bahutvābhāvāttadepakṣatvācca kṛtsnatvavyavahārasya /
analyzed: tathā avayavinaḥ u pi avayaveṣu na kārtsnyam saṃbhavati bahu tva abhāvāt tad epakṣa tvāt ca kṛtsna tva vyavahārasya
translated: Similarly, for the whole, entirety is not possible in the parts, because of the absence of plurality and because the usage of entirety is based on that.

analyzed: avayavaśas vṛttiḥ api avayava antara abhāvāt ayuktā eva
translated: The existence in parts is also not proper because of the absence of other parts.

analyzed: kim idānīm eka rūpā eva sāmānyasya vyaktiṣu avayaveṣu ca avayavinaḥ vṛttiḥ
translated: Now, is the existence of the universal in the individuals and the whole in the parts only of one form?

analyzed: na iti ucyate
translated: It is said no.

analyzed: sāmānyam pratyekam vartata
translated: The universal exists in each individual.

original: avayavīṃ tu vyāsajyetyevaṃ viśeṣaḥ /🔽vyaktyantaramanapekṣyaiva vyaktyantare vartamānā svānurūpāṃ buddhiṃ janayantī jātiḥ pratyekaṃ ityucyate na tu kātsnyena vṛttiḥ /
analyzed: avayavīm tu vyāsajya iti evam viśeṣaḥ  vyakti antaram an apekṣya eva vyakti antare vartamānā sva anurūpām buddhim janayantī jātiḥ pratyekam iti ucyate na tu kātsnyena vṛttiḥ
translated: But the whole extends over the parts. This is the difference.🔽The universal, without depending on another individual, existing in another individual, producing a cognition in accordance with itself, is said to exist in each individual, but not by its entirety.

original: avayavī tvavayavāntarāṇyapekṣyāvāntare vartamānaḥ svākāraṃ buddhiṃ janayan vyāsajya vartata iti vyapadiśyate /
analyzed: avayavī tu avayava antarāṇi apekṣya avāntare vartamānaḥ sva ākāram buddhim janayan vyāsajya vartate iti vyapadiśyate
translated: But the whole, depending on the other parts, existing in the other parts, producing a cognition in its own form, is designated as extending over.

analyzed: nahi ekasyām eva vyaktau go buddhi vat ekasmin eva tantau paṭa buddhiḥ utpadyate
translated: For, like the cognition of a cow in a single individual cow, the cognition of a cloth does not arise in a single thread.

analyzed: saṃyoga vicāraḥ
translated: The Discussion of Conjunction

original: saṃyogasyedānīṃ kathaṃ saṃyogiṣu vṛttiḥ kiṃ jātivat kiṃvāvayavivat /
analyzed: saṃyogasya idānīm katham saṃyogiṣu vṛttiḥ kim jāti vat kiṃvā avayavi vat
translated: Now, how does conjunction exist in the conjoined? Is it like a universal or like a whole?

analyzed: ubhaya vilakṣaṇā iti brūmaḥ
translated: We say it is unlike both.

original: sa hi saṃyogyantaramapekṣya saṃyogyantare vartate nānapekṣyeti na jātitulyatvam /
analyzed: sa hi saṃyogi antaram apekṣya saṃyogi antare vartate na an apekṣya iti na jāti tulya tvam
translated: For it exists in another conjoined thing in dependence on it, not independently, so it is not the same as a universal.

original: ekatraiva ca svānurūpāṃ janayati buddhim idamanena saṃyuktamidamanena iti /
analyzed: ekatra eva ca sva anurūpām janayati buddhim idam anena saṃyuktam idam anena iti
translated: And it produces a cognition in one place that corresponds to itself, thinking this is conjoined with that, this with that.

analyzed: tena avayavinā api na atīva tulya tvam iti ubhaya vailakṣaṇyam
translated: Therefore, it is not very similar even to a whole, so it is unlike both.

original: atha saṃyogaḥ kimeka eva dvayoḥ saṃyoginoruta pratisaṃyogi bhinnāveva saṃyogau /
analyzed: atha saṃyogaḥ kim ekaḥ eva dvayoḥ saṃyoginoḥ uta pratisaṃyogi bhinnau eva saṃyogau
translated: Now, is conjunction the same in two conjoined things, or are the conjunctions different for each conjoined thing?

original: kāśyapīyāstāvat saṃyogamubhayorvyāsaktamekaṃ manyante vayaṃ tu yathā idamanena sadṛśamidamaneneti
analyzed: kāśyapīyāḥ tāvat saṃyogam ubhayoḥ vyāsaktam ekam manyante vayam tu yathā idam anena sadṛśam idam anena iti
translated: The Kāśyapīyas think that conjunction is one, pervading both. But we think that just as similarity is cognized as different in relation to its counterpart,🔽This is similar to that, this to that,

analyzed: pratiyoginam apekṣya itaratra itarasya avagamyamānam sādṛśyam pratidharmi bhinnam bhavati
translated: it becomes different from the property-possessor.

analyzed: tathā saṃyogasya tādṛśa buddhi viṣaya tvāt bhedam eva rocayāmahe
translated: Similarly, we prefer difference because conjunction is the object of such cognition.

analyzed: prakṛtam anusarāmaḥ tasmāt na vṛtti vikalpāt api jāti apahnavaḥ
translated: We continue the main topic. Therefore, the denial of universals is not due to the alternatives of inherence.

analyzed: yat tu nitya tvāt jāteḥ sva viṣaya jñāna janana asāmarthyāt na grāhya tvam iti
translated: As for the argument that universals are not apprehended because they are eternal and incapable of producing cognition of themselves,

analyzed: tat asat
translated: that is wrong.

analyzed: nityānām api arthakriyā sāmarthyam kṣaṇa bhaṅga nirākaraṇe vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will explain in the refutation of momentariness that even eternal things have causal efficacy.

analyzed: na ca hetu lakṣaṇam grāhya tvam
translated: And apprehensibility is not the definition of a reason.

analyzed: jñāna janya phala bhāgi tva lakṣaṇam hi tat iti śūnyavāde varṇitam
translated: For that is defined as the possession of a result produced by cognition, as described in the doctrine of emptiness.

analyzed: tasmāt ayam api adoṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, this is also a faultless argument.

original: yattu svalakṣaṇaireva svānubhavadvāreṇa gavādivikalpodayasaṃbhavādaprāmāṇikī jātivikalpaneti tadapyasāram /
analyzed: yat tu sva lakṣaṇaiḥ eva sva anubhava dvāreṇa gavādi vikalpa udaya saṃbhavāt aprāmāṇikī jāti vikalpanā iti tat api asāram
translated: As for the argument that the postulation of universals is not authoritative because the arising of conceptual thoughts like cow is possible through the experience of individual characteristics themselves, that is also weak.

original: na hi jātirna dṛśyate yenaivamupālambhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: na hi jātiḥ na dṛśyate yena evam upālambhaḥ syāt
translated: For the universal is not unseen, by which there could be such a reproach.

original: upajāyamānaṃ tu jñānaṃ svaviṣayabhūtāṃ jātimupasthāpayatīti nedṛśānāṃ pralāpanāmavasaraḥ ////
analyzed: upajāyamānam tu jñānam sva viṣaya bhūtām jātim upasthāpayati iti na īdṛśānām pralāpanām avasaraḥ
translated: But the arising cognition manifests the universal which is its object. Therefore, there is no occasion for such prattle.

original: kathañcātyantavilakṣaṇāni svalakṣaṇānyekarūpaṃ vijñānaṃ janayanti tadatadrūpiṇo bhāvāstadatadrūpahetujāḥ iti sthiteḥ /
analyzed: kathañca atyanta vilakṣaṇāni sva lakṣaṇāni eka rūpam vijñānam janayanti tad a tad rūpiṇaḥ bhāvāḥ tad a tad rūpa hetu jāḥ iti sthiteḥ
translated: And how do extremely dissimilar individual characteristics produce a cognition of a single form? Because things that are not of that form are born from causes that are not of that form.

analyzed: bhavataḥ vā katham vilakṣaṇānām viśeṣāṇām eka rūpa sāmānya saṃbandha kāraṇa tvam iti ced
translated: Or how can dissimilar particulars be the cause of connection with a single form universal?

analyzed: dātmyam samavāyam vā bhajante
translated: They are related to the universal by inherence or by inherence in something inhering in them.

original: nanu hetavo vilakṣaṇaḥ kathamekavidhasāmarthyayuktāni svalakṣaṇāni janayanti /
analyzed: nanu hetavaḥ vilakṣaṇaḥ katham ekavidha sāmarthya yuktāni sva lakṣaṇāni janayanti
translated: But how can causes that are dissimilar produce individual characteristics that are of a single kind?

original: na janayeyuryadi vilakṣaṇāḥ syuste 'pi tvekajātīyā eva //
analyzed: na janayeyuḥ yadi vilakṣaṇāḥ syuḥ te tu eka jātīyāḥ eva
translated: They would not produce them if they were dissimilar. But they are of the same kind.

analyzed: nanu evam tad saṃbandha sidhi artha para apara jāti apekṣāyām anavasthā
translated: But if so, there is an infinite regress in requiring more and more kinds for the sake of establishing their connection.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: yathā tālabījamekajātīyaṃ pariṇāmaparaṃparayā tālajātīsaṃbaddhāṃ🔽vyaktimupajanayati /🔽sāpi tathaiva svakāraṇabhūtabījasamānajātīyaṃ bījāntaram /
analyzed: yathā tāla bījam eka jātīyam pariṇāma paraṃparayā tāla jātī saṃbaddhām  vyaktim upajanayati  sā api tathā eva sva kāraṇa bhūta bīja samāna jātīyam bīja antaram
translated: Just as a palm seed, of a single kind, produces an individual connected to the palm kind through a series of transformations,🔽and that [individual] in the same way produces another seed of the same kind as the seed that was its cause,

analyzed: tathā eka jātīya chukrāt go jātīya vyakti niṣpattiḥ tasyām ca
translated: and from the semen of the same kind, an individual of the cow kind is produced, and in that [individual],

analyzed: tad jātīya śukra niṣpattiḥ iti na atyantam tādātmya āpattiḥ
translated: the production of semen of the same kind occurs, so there is no absolute attainment of identity.

analyzed: tasmāt asti ekam ākṛti jāti sāmānya śabda abhilapanīyam śābaleya ādiṣu anugatam
translated: Therefore, there exists a single universal, which is the common form, and is denoted by words like 'cow', and is present in all individual cows like Śābaleya.

analyzed: iti ākṛti vādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the discussion on the universal.

analyzed: sādṛśya ādīnām sāmānya tva khaṇḍanam
translated: Refutation of similarity and other properties as universals.

analyzed: na ca sādṛśyam eva sāmānyam tad buddhi abhāvāt
translated: Similarity itself is not a universal, because there is no cognition of it as such.

original: sa evāyamiti pratītirna tattatsadṛśa iti /🔽na ca sarvasāmānyāpahnavavādinaḥ sādṛśyamapi saṃbhavati bhūyovayavasāmānyātmakatvāttasya //
analyzed: saḥ eva ayam iti pratītiḥ na tad tad sadṛśaḥ iti  na ca sarva sāmānya apahnava vādinaḥ sādṛśyam api saṃbhavati bhūyas vayava sāmānya ātmaka tvāt tasya
translated: The cognition is of the form this is the same as that, not this is similar to that.🔽And for one who denies all universals, similarity itself is not possible, because it consists of the commonness of many parts.

analyzed: na ca a tad vyāvṛtti rūpam api samānyam anaṅgīkṛta vidhi rūpa sāmānyena śakyate pratyetum
translated: And a universal that is not of the nature of exclusion of the non-universal cannot be cognized by a universal that is not accepted to be of the nature of injunction.

original: agovyāvṛttiṃ hi pratīyatāvaśyaṃ prathamameva gauḥ pratyetavyaḥ /
analyzed: a go vyāvṛttim hi pratīyatā avaśyam prathamam eva gauḥ pratyetavyaḥ
translated: For when the exclusion of the non-cow is cognized, the cow must necessarily be cognized first.

original: na hi tebhyo vyatirekarūpamapahāyāśvādivyaktīnāṃ prātisvikena rūpeṇa saṃbhavati /
analyzed: na hi tebhyaḥ vyatireka rūpam apahāya aśva ādi vyaktīnām prātisvikena rūpeṇa saṃbhavati
translated: For the form of exclusion from them cannot be the individual form of the individual horses and other animals.

analyzed: teṣām anantānām buddhau anārohāt
translated: Because those are infinite and cannot be brought into the cognition.

original: anārūḍheṣu ca teṣu tadvyāvṛttirūpasya goḥ pratyetumaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: an ārūḍheṣu ca teṣu tad vyāvṛtti rūpasya goḥ pratyetum aśakya tvāt
translated: And when they are not brought in, the form of exclusion from them cannot be cognized as a cow.

original: gaurgauriti ca vidhirūpaṃ sāmānyamavagamyamānaṃ kathaṃ nivṛttirūpaṃ śakyamaṅgīkartum /
analyzed: gauḥ gauḥ iti ca vidhi rūpam sāmānyam avagamyamānam katham nivṛtti rūpam śakyam aṅgīkartum
translated: How can the universal, which is apprehended as having the form of injunction, be accepted as having the form of exclusion?

analyzed: tasmāt idam ati pelavam darśanam
translated: Therefore, this view is extremely weak.

analyzed: tasmāt asti jātiḥ
translated: Therefore, there is a universal.

analyzed: iti apoha vādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the discussion on Apoha.
The Discussion on Parts.

analyzed: etena avayavi vyākhyātaḥ
translated: By this, the whole is explained.

original: tasyāpyavayavebhyo bhedo 'bhedo veti vikalpe bhedaṃ samavāyasaṃbandhamavayavaguṇebhyaśca tatra viśeṣaguṇānāmutpattimacakṣate vaiśeṣikāḥ /
analyzed: tasya api avayavebhyaḥ bhedaḥ bhedaḥ vā iti vikalpe bhedam samavāya saṃbandham avayava guṇebhyaḥ ca tatra viśeṣa guṇānām utpattim acakṣate vaiśeṣikāḥ
translated: The Vaisheshikas say that it has difference or non-difference from the parts, and that difference is the relation of inherence, and that special qualities arise from the qualities of the parts.

original: ye ca svasamavetaviśeṣaṇaviśiṣṭāḥ svāśrayasyaikajātīyasya paricchedakāste viśeṣaguṇā ityāhuḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sva samaveta viśeṣaṇa viśiṣṭāḥ sva āśrayasya eka jātīyasya paricchedakāḥ te viśeṣa guṇāḥ iti āhuḥ
translated: And they say that those which are qualified by their own inherent qualifiers and which delimit their own substratum of the same species are special qualities.

analyzed: vayam tu bhinna abhinna tvam
translated: But we say that it is both different and non-different.

original: nahitantubhyaḥ śiraḥpāṇyādibhyo nāvayebhyo niṣkṛṣṭaḥ paṭo devadatto vā pratīyate /
analyzed: na hi tantubhyaḥ śiraḥ pāṇi ādibhyaḥ na avayebhyaḥ niṣkṛṣṭaḥ paṭaḥ devadattaḥ vā pratīyate
translated: For a cloth or Devadatta is not perceived as extracted from the different parts such as threads, head, hands, etc.

analyzed: tantu pāṇi ādayaḥ vayavāḥ eva paṭa ādi ātmanā pratīyante
translated: The parts such as threads and hands are perceived themselves in the form of cloth etc.

original: vidyate ca devadatte asya hastaḥ śira ityādiḥ kiyānapi bhedāvabhāsa ityupapannamubhayātmakatvam /
analyzed: vidyate ca devadatte asya hastaḥ śiraḥ ityādiḥ kiyān api bheda avabhāsaḥ iti upapannam ubhaya ātmaka tvam
translated: And there is some appearance of difference even in Devadatta, such as this is his hand, this is his head, etc. Thus, the nature of being both is established.

analyzed: tasmāt avayavānām eva avasthā antaram avayavī na drāvya antaram
translated: Therefore, the parts themselves are in a different state, not a different substance.

original: ta eva hi saṃyogaviśeṣavaśādakadravyatāmāpadyatesa tadātmanā ca mahatvaṃ paṭajātiṃ ca vibhrataḥ paṭabuddhyā gṛhyante /
analyzed: te eva hi saṃyoga viśeṣa vaśāt aka dravya tām āpadyate sa tad ātmanā ca mahat tvam paṭa jātim ca vibhrataḥ paṭa buddhyā gṛhyante
translated: They themselves, by the power of a particular conjunction, attain the state of a non-composite substance. It has that as its self, and having greatness and the universal of cloth, it is grasped by the cognition of cloth.

original: tena paṭātmanā teṣāmekatvam avayavātmanā tu nānātvamupapannam ////
analyzed: tena paṭa ātmanā teṣām eka tvam avayava ātmanā tu nānātvam upapannam
translated: By that self of cloth, they are one, but by the self of parts, their diversity is established.

original: yadapi rūpādayaḥ kārye guṇamārabhate ityuktaṃ tadapari guṇadvayapratītyabhāvīnnātītavāsmabhyaṃ rocate /
analyzed: yat api rūpa ādayaḥ kārye guṇam ārabhate iti uktam tat apari rocate
translated: As for what was said that color etc. produces a quality in the effect, we do not accept that, because the perception of two qualities is not possible.

original: yadi hi dvau guṇau pratīyeyātāṃ tantuṣvekaḥ paṭe cāparastataḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvaṃ pratipadyeyātām /
analyzed: yadi hi dvau guṇau pratīyeyātām tantuṣu ekaḥ paṭe ca aparaḥ tatas kārya kāraṇa bhāvam pratipadyeyātām
translated: For if two qualities were perceived, one in the threads and another in the cloth, then they would enter into the relation of cause and effect.

original: yatrāpi nānārūpaiḥ śuklakṛṣṇaraktapītaistantubhirārabhyate paṭastastrāpi ta eva varṇāḥ paṭagatāḥ pratīyante na rūpāntaram //
analyzed: yatra api nānā rūpaiḥ śukla kṛṣṇa rakta pītaiḥ tantubhiḥ ārabhyate paṭaḥ tastra api te eva varṇāḥ paṭa gatāḥ pratīyante na rūpa antaram
translated: Even where a cloth is produced from threads of various colors - white, black, red, and yellow - only those colors are perceived in the cloth, not a different color.

analyzed: citra eka rūpa nirākaraṇam
translated: Refutation of variegated single color.

original: nanu citraḥ paṭa iti pratīyate na tu śuklaḥ pūta iti vā /
analyzed: nanu citraḥ paṭaḥ iti pratīyate na tu śuklaḥ pūtaḥ iti vā
translated: But it is perceived as variegated cloth, not as white or yellow.

analyzed: tasmāt citra ākhyam rūpa antaram atra utpannam
translated: Therefore, a different color called variegated is produced here.

analyzed: na evam
translated: No, it is not so.

analyzed: citram loka virodhāt eva ayuktam aṅgīkartum
translated: It is strange that people should be unwilling to accept what is reasonable, simply because it is contrary to popular opinion.

analyzed: nānā rūpāṇām api ca avayava bheda dvāreṇa ekasmin api paṭe samavāyaḥ na anupapannaḥ
translated: And it is not impossible for things of various forms to inhere in a single thing, such as a cloth, through the medium of their component parts.

analyzed: etena saṃyoga ja saṃyogaḥ nirastaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: By this, it should be understood that the conjunction produced by conjunction is refuted.

original: yathā devadattasaṃyoga eva tasminkuṇḍalisaṃyogo bhavati tathā tantuturīsaṃyoga eva
analyzed: yathā devadatta saṃyoge eva tasmin kuṇḍali saṃyogaḥ bhavati tathā tantu turī saṃyoge eva
translated: Just as the conjunction of Devadatta itself becomes the conjunction of the earring in him, so the conjunction of the thread and the shuttle itself becomes the conjunction of the cloth and the shuttle

original: tantau paṭabhāvamāpanne paṭaturīsaṃyogo bhavati na saṃyogāntaraṃ pratītyabhāvādityalamativistareṇa /
analyzed: tantau paṭa bhāvam āpanne paṭa turī saṃyogaḥ bhavati na saṃyoga antaram pratīti abhāvāt iti alam ati vistareṇa
translated: when the thread has attained the state of cloth, there is no other conjunction, because there is no dependence on another. Enough of this extensive discussion.

analyzed: tasmāt asti eva avayavī
translated: Therefore, the whole certainly exists.

analyzed: vṛttiḥ sva avayaveṣu asya vyāsajyā iti pradarśitam
translated: It has been shown that its existence is extended over its parts.

analyzed: tena asi avayavi dravyam sāmānyam ca asti sarvagam
translated: Therefore, it has the universal of substance which is whole and is all-pervading.

analyzed: iti avayavi vādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the discussion on the whole.

analyzed: varṇānām abhidhātṛ tvam ākṛteḥ ca abhidheya tām
translated: Having explained the denotativeness of letters and the denotability of form,

analyzed: kathayitvā atha saṃbandha kathā eva prakṛtā ucyate
translated: now the topic of relation is being stated.

analyzed: jñāpya jñāpaka bhāvaḥ ca saṃbandhaḥ prāk udīritaḥ
translated: The relation is said to be the relation of the perceptible and the imperceptible.

analyzed: tad nitya tvam yat ākṣiptam tat samādhīyate dhunā
translated: When its eternality is questioned, it is being resolved now.

original: evaṃ hi pūrvamuktam yasmātprathamaśravaṇe śabdor'thaṃ na pratyāyayati tasmānnāsya svābhāvikamindriyavatpratyāyakatvam /
analyzed: evam hi pūrvam uktam yasmāt prathama śravaṇe śabdaḥ ṛtham na pratyāyayati tasmāt na asya svābhāvikam indriya vat pratyāyaka tvam
translated: For this has been said before: Since the word does not convey the meaning at the first hearing, therefore its natural power to convey, like that of the senses, is not accepted.

analyzed: asya ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning:

original: iti puruṣeṇa kathite pratyāyayati tato nūnamasya puruṣakṛtaṃ pratyāyakatvamiti pauruṣeya eva saṃbandha iti ////
analyzed: iti puruṣeṇa kathite pratyāyayati tatas nūnam asya puruṣa kṛtam pratyāyaka tvam iti pauruṣeyaḥ eva saṃbandhaḥ iti
translated: When this is stated by a person, it conveys the meaning. Therefore, its power to convey is certainly created by a person. Thus, the relation is indeed created by a person.

analyzed: tatra abhidhīyate na hi asya ayam arthaḥ iti  saṃbandha karaṇam idam
translated: To that, it is said: This is not the meaning of this [statement].🔽This is not a statement about the creation of the relation.

analyzed: prasiddha saṃbandha kathanam hi etat
translated: This is a statement about a well-known relation.

analyzed: katham avagamyate artha antara kathane bahubhiḥ nivāraṇāt
translated: How is this understood? From the prevention by many in the statement of a different meaning.

original: yo hi kaścit kasmaicit gośabdasyāśvaṃ gavayaṃ vārthamāha tamanye nivārayanti nāyamasyārthaḥ sāsnādimānasyārtha iti /
analyzed: yaḥ hi kaścid kasmaicid go śabdasya aśvam gavayam vā artham āha tam anye nivārayanti na ayam asya arthaḥ sāsnādimān asya arthaḥ iti
translated: Whoever tells someone that the word 'cow' means a horse or a gayal, others prevent him, saying This is not its meaning, its meaning is the one with a dewlap, etc.

original: saṃbandhakriyāpakṣe ca devadattādivadyenaiva saṃbandhaḥ kriyate sa evārtha iti nivāraṇaṃ nopapadyate /
analyzed: saṃbandha kriyā pakṣe ca devadatta ādi vat yena eva saṃbandhaḥ kriyate saḥ eva arthaḥ iti nivāraṇam na upapadyate
translated: And in the case of the relation being created, just as in the case of Devadatta, the same person by whom the relation is created, he alone is the meaning. The prevention is not possible.

original: tasmānna tāvadarvācīnaḥ puruṣā asya śabdasyāyamartha iti vadantopi tatsaṃbandhakartṛtvenāśaṅkanīyāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt na tāvat arvācīnaḥ puruṣāḥ asya śabdasya ayam arthaḥ iti vadantaḥ api tad saṃbandha kartṛ tvena āśaṅkanīyāḥ
translated: Therefore, even those who say that the meaning of this word is not modern, when speaking of him, should not be suspected as the author of that connection.

original: yadiparamevaṃ syāt sargādikāle bhagavatā prajāpatinā sarvameva sthāvarajaṅgamaṃ dharmādharmau🔽ta sṛṣṭvā saṃvyavahārāya ca śabdānāmarthaiḥ saṃbandhaṃ kṛtvā dharmādharmapratipādanāya
analyzed: yadi param evam syāt sarga ādi kāle bhagavatā prajāpatinā sarvam eva sthāvara jaṅgamam dharma adharmau  ta sṛṣṭvā saṃvyavahārāya ca śabdānām arthaiḥ saṃbandham kṛtvā dharma adharma pratipādanāya
translated: If it were so, then at the time of creation, the Lord Prajapati would have created all the moving and unmoving, dharma and adharma,🔽and for the sake of transactions, would have created the connection between words and meanings,🔽and having created the Vedas with the connected words for teaching dharma and adharma,

original: ca kṛtasaṃbandhaiḥ padairvedānkṛtvātmajebhyo marīcyādibhyaḥ śabdārthasaṃbandho vedāśca🔽pratipāditāstairapyanyebhyastairapyanyebhya ityevaṃ pūrvapūrvebhyaḥ pratipadyottarottareṣāṃ
analyzed: ca kṛta saṃbandhaiḥ padaiḥ vedān kṛtvā ātmajebhyaḥ marīci ādibhyaḥ śabda artha saṃbandhaḥ vedāḥ ca  pratipāditāḥ taiḥ api anyebhyaḥ taiḥ api anyebhyaḥ iti evam pūrva pūrvebhyaḥ pratipadya uttara uttareṣām
translated: would have taught the connection between words and meanings and the Vedas to his sons Marichi and others,

analyzed: śabda artha pratipattiḥ vyavahāraḥ ca iti
translated: and they would have taught it to others, and they to others, and thus the understanding of the meaning of words and the transactions of the later generations would have been based on the earlier ones.

analyzed: tat api ayuktam
translated: This is also incorrect.

original: itthaṃbhāve pramāṇābhāvāt prathamaśrutāvapratītireva pramāṇaṃ sāmayikatve hyapratipannasamayānāmapratītiḥ pratipannasamayānāṃ ca pratītirdevadattādiśabdavadupapannā
analyzed: itthaṃbhāve pramāṇa abhāvāt prathama śrutau apratītiḥ eva pramāṇam sāmayika tve hi apratipanna samayānām apratītiḥ pratipanna samayānām ca pratītiḥ devadatta ādi śabda vat upapannā
translated: Because there is no evidence for such a state of affairs, the very non-understanding at the first hearing is the evidence. For if it were conventional, then the non-understanding of those who have not learned the convention and the understanding of those who have learned the convention would be possible, like the word Devadatta and so on.

analyzed: svābhāvike tu pratyāyaka tve
translated: But if the power of conveying the meaning is natural,

analyzed: prathama śravaṇe pi pratītiḥ syāt iti ced na
translated: then the meaning would be understood even on the first hearing. If it is said that this is not so,

original: svābhāvikamapi pratyāyakatvamavagataṃ sadarthapratipattau nimittaṃ nāpratipannamiti yuktaiva prathamaśravaṇer'thasyāpratītiḥ /
analyzed: svābhāvikam api pratyāyaka tvam avagatam sat artha pratipattau nimittam na apratipannam iti yuktā eva prathama śravaṇa īrthasya apratītiḥ
translated: then it is proper that the meaning is not understood on the first hearing, because even the natural power of conveying the meaning, when known, is the cause for understanding the meaning, not when not known.

analyzed: na ca sarga ādiḥ nāma kaścid kālaḥ sti
translated: And there is no such time as creation, etc.

analyzed: sarvadā hi īdṛśam eva jagat iti dṛṣṭa anusārāt avagantum ucitam
translated: It is proper to understand that the world is always of this kind, following the seen.

original: na tu sa kālo 'bhūt yadā sarvamidaṃ nāsīditi /
analyzed: na tu sa kālaḥ bhūt yadā sarvam idam na āsīt iti
translated: But it is not so that there was a time when all this did not exist.

analyzed: pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no evidence.

analyzed: mantra arthavāda itihāsa purāṇa ādiḥ pramāṇam iti ced na
translated: If it is said that the mantra, arthavada, itihāsa, purāṇa, etc. are the evidence, it is not so.

original: vedānāṃ pauruṣeyasaṃbandhāpekṣāṇāṃ svayaṃ ca pauruṣeyāṇāṃ śākyādigranthavadatīndriyārthe prāmāṇyāsaṃbhavāt /
analyzed: vedānām pauruṣeya saṃbandha apekṣāṇām svayam ca pauruṣeyāṇām śākya ādi grantha vat atīndriya arthe prāmāṇya asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because the Vedas, which depend on human connection, and which are themselves human, cannot be valid regarding imperceptible things, like the Shakyapuri scriptures, etc.

original: tadaprāmāmye ca tanmūlānāṃ dharmaśāstrīdīnāṃ dūranirastameva prāmāṇyam /
analyzed: tad aprāmāmye ca tad mūlānām dharma śāstrī dīnām dūra nirastam eva prāmāṇyam
translated: And if they are not valid, then the validity of the Dharma Shastras, etc., which are based on them, is far removed.

analyzed: sarva abhāve ca sṛṣṭiḥ api na saṃbhavati
translated: And in the absence of everything, creation also is not possible.

analyzed: mṛd ta tantu ādi upādānena hi ghaṭa ādīni upādīyante
translated: For pots, etc. are produced by the material cause such as clay, thread, etc.

analyzed: sarva abhāve hi kena upādena sarvam idam upādeyam
translated: For in the absence of all [other means], by what means is all this to be accepted?

analyzed: advaita matena pūrvapakṣaḥ
translated: The prima facie view is from the non-dualistic standpoint.

analyzed: syāt matam
translated: It may be thought:

original: ātmaivaiko jagadādāvāsīt sa eva svecchayā vyomādi pariṇamati bījamiva vṛkṣarūpeṇa /
analyzed: ātmā eva ekaḥ jagat ādau āsīt saḥ eva sva icchayā vyoma ādi pariṇamati bījam iva vṛkṣa rūpeṇa
translated: The Self alone existed in the beginning of the world. It alone, by its own will, transforms into space etc., like a seed into the form of a tree.

original: cidekarasaṃ brahma kathaṃ jaḍarūpeṇa pariṇamatīti cet /
analyzed: cit ekarasam brahma katham jaḍa rūpeṇa pariṇamati iti ced
translated: If it is asked how Brahman, which is of the nature of pure consciousness, transforms into the form of the insentient,

original: na paramārthataḥ pariṇāmaṃ brūmaḥ kintvapariṇamate pariṇatavadekameva sadanekadhā
analyzed: na paramārthataḥ pariṇāmam brūmaḥ kintu apariṇamate pariṇata vat ekam eva sat anekadhā
translated: we do not say it transforms in reality. Rather, it remains unchanged, yet appears manifold like one face in many mirrors.

analyzed: mukham iva ādarśa ādiṣu avidyā vaśāt vivartamānam ātmā eva ātmānam cit rūpam jaḍa rūpam iva advitīyam
translated: The Self itself, by the power of ignorance, appears as if it were of the nature of consciousness and insentience, as if it were not alone,

analyzed: sa a dvitīyam iva paśyati
translated: as if it had a second.

analyzed: sā iyam avidyā upādānā svapna prapañca vat mahat ādi prapañca sṛṣṭiḥ
translated: This creation of the world, beginning with Mahat, is like the creation of a dream, based on ignorance.

analyzed: tathā ca sarvam khalu idam brahma
translated: And thus, All this is Brahman.

original: ātmaivedaṃ sarvaṃ naiha nānāsti kiñcane ityādayo bahavo 'dvetavādāḥ /
analyzed: ātmā eva idam sarvam na iha nānā asti kiñcane ityādayaḥ bahavaḥ
translated: The Self is all this; there is no multiplicity here at all, and so on - these are many non-dualistic teachings.

original: tathā indro māyābhiḥ pururūpa īyate iti bhedāvagatervyaktameva māyānibandhanatvaṃ darśitam /
analyzed: tathā indraḥ māyābhiḥ puru rūpaḥ īyate iti bheda avagateḥ vyaktam eva māyā nibandhana tvam darśitam
translated: Similarly, Indra moves about with many forms through illusions, this clearly shows that the cognition of difference is based on illusion.

original: tathā lokāstaṃ parāduryo 'nyatrātmano lokānvidetyādinānātmadarśane nindā mṛtyoḥ sa🔽mṛtyumāpnoti ya iha nāneva paśyatīti ca nānātvadarśananindā sarvamidamadvitīyameva
analyzed: tathā lokāḥ tam parāduḥ yaḥ nyatra ātmanaḥ lokān vidā ityādinā nānā ātma darśane nindā mṛtyoḥ sa  mṛtyum āpnoti yaḥ iha nānā iva paśyati iti ca nānātva darśana nindā sarvam idam advitīyam eva
translated: Similarly, there is a condemnation of the view of non-self in passages such as Those who know the worlds other than the self go to the highest, and a condemnation of the view of diversity in He who sees diversity here attains death with death. All this indicates the truth that Brahman alone is without a second, and the view of difference is due to ignorance and superimposition.

analyzed: brahma pāramārthikam bheda dṛṣṭiḥ ca avidyā upādānā iti etam artham prakaṭayati iti
translated: Thus, this meaning is made clear.
Refutation of the doctrine of non-duality stated.

analyzed: kim idānīm asan eva ayam prapañcaḥ
translated: Is this world of multiplicity then non-existent?

analyzed: omiticed na
translated: If it is said to be so, no.

analyzed: pratyakṣa virodhāt
translated: Because of contradiction with perception.

analyzed: tathā ca pratyakṣam prapañca sadbhāva grāhakam pratyakṣasūtre
translated: And perception is the means of knowing the existence of the world of multiplicity, as stated in the aphorism on perception.

original: nacāgame pratyakṣabādhaḥ saṃbhavati pratyakṣasya śīghrapravṛttatvena sarvebhyo balīyastvāt /
analyzed: na ca āgame pratyakṣa bādhaḥ saṃbhavati pratyakṣasya śīghra pravṛtta tvena sarvebhyaḥ balīyaḥ tvāt
translated: And revelation cannot contradict perception, because perception is stronger than all others due to its quick operation.

original: na ca paurvāparyanyāyena pravṛttameva pratyakṣamāgamena paścādbādhyata iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca paurvāparya nyāyena pravṛttam eva pratyakṣam āgamena paścāt bādhyate iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that perception, which operates first, is contradicted later by revelation.

analyzed: āgamasya pratyakṣeṇa pravṛtti virodhāt
translated: Because revelation contradicts the operation of perception.

analyzed: āgama pravṛtti samaye hi beda prapañcam upadarśayat pratyakṣam āgama pravṛttim eva niruṇaddhi
translated: Even at the time of the operation of revelation, perception, which shows the world of multiplicity, obstructs the operation of revelation itself.

original: yathā khalūtpattumupakramamāṇa eva ghaṭo daṇḍenāhanyamāno notpattuṃ prabhavati tathāgamopi /
analyzed: yathā khalu utpattum upakramamāṇaḥ eva ghaṭaḥ daṇḍena āhanyamānaḥ na utpattum prabhavati tathā āgamaḥ api
translated: Just as a pot, even when it is about to be produced, cannot be produced when struck by a stick, so too revelation.

analyzed: kiñca prapañca abhāvam pratiyata avaśyam āgamaḥ api prapañca antargata tvāt asat rūpa tayā pratyetavyaḥ
translated: Moreover, in regard to the non-existence of the world, revelation must necessarily be cognized as unreal, being included within the world.

analyzed: katham  ca āgamena eva āgamasya abhāvaḥ pratīyeta
translated: How?🔽And how could the non-existence of revelation be known by revelation itself?

original: asadrūpatayā hi pratīyamāno na kasyacidapyarthasya pramāṇaṃ syāt /
analyzed: asat rūpa tayā hi pratīyamānaḥ na kasyacid api arthasya pramāṇam syāt
translated: For if it is cognized as unreal, it would not be a valid means of knowledge for anything at all.

analyzed: prāmāṇye vā na a sattvam
translated: Or if it is valid, it cannot be unreal.

analyzed: kaścid punar āha prapañcasya na asattvam brūmaḥ
translated: But someone else says: We do not say that the world is unreal.

analyzed: pratyaśra kṣa ādi pramāṇataḥ siddha tvāt
translated: Because it is established by means of valid knowledge such as perception.

analyzed: na api paramārthataḥ sattvam ātma jñānena bādhyamāna tvāt
translated: Nor is it real in the ultimate sense, because it is contradicted by the knowledge of the self.

analyzed: tasmāt sat asat bhāva nirvācyaḥ yam prapañcaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, this world is to be described as both real and unreal.

analyzed: tat idam asāram  sataḥ nya tvam eva a sa tvam
translated: This is worthless.🔽Unreality is nothing but being different from what is real.

analyzed: tat yadi prapañcaḥ san na bhavati vyaktam asan eva ayam
translated: If the world is not real, it is clearly unreal.
Or if unreality does not exist, it would become real.

analyzed: sat asatvayoḥ eka niṣedhasya itara vidhi nāntarīyaka tvāt
translated: Because the negation of one of reality and unreality is invariably accompanied by the affirmation of the other.

original: na ca vidhādvayarahite vidhāntaraṃ sambhavati athāpi yanna kadācitpratīyate tadasat /
analyzed: na ca vidhā dvaya rahite vidhā antaram sambhavati atha api yat na kadācid pratīyate tat asat
translated: And when something is devoid of injunction and prohibition, another injunction is not possible. Even if what is never cognized is non-existent,

analyzed: yathā śaśaviṣāṇam
translated: like the horn of a rabbit.

analyzed: yat pratītam kadācid bādhyate tat sat yathātmatatvam
translated: What is cognized and sometimes contradicted is existent, like the true nature of the self.

analyzed: prapañcaḥ tu pratīyamāna tvāt bādhyamāna tvāt ca bhāva abhāva abhyāsa nirvāt ca iti matam
translated: But the view is that the world is both existent and non-existent, because it is cognized and contradicted, and because it is accomplished by the practice of existence and non-existence.

analyzed: tat anupapannam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: loka virodhāt
translated: Because it contradicts worldly experience.

original: yaddhi pratītaṃ bādhyate mṛgatoyapajjusarpādi tadasadeveti hi laukikī prasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: yat hi pratītam bādhyate mṛga toya pajju sarpa ādi tat asat eva iti hi laukikī prasiddhiḥ
translated: For the worldly consensus is that what is cognized and contradicted, like mirage-water, rope-snake, etc., is indeed non-existent.

original: na hi śaśaviṣāṇādīnāṃ mṛgatoyādīnāṃ ca kaścidviśeṣo loke /🔽soyaṃ prapañcopi bādyate cet asanneveti nānirvācitatvam /
analyzed: na hi śaśaviṣāṇa ādīnām mṛga toya ādīnām ca kaścid viśeṣaḥ loke  saḥ uyam prapañcaḥ api bādyate ced asan evā iti na anirvācita tvam
translated: For there is no difference between the horn of a rabbit and mirage-water in the world.🔽So if this world is also contradicted, it is indeed non-existent, so it is not unaccomplished.

analyzed: atha api loka prasiddhim an ādṛtya vṛddhayā ādi vat paribhāṣā rūpeṇa anirvācyaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Even if, disregarding worldly consensus, it is said to be inexpressible in the form of a definition like old age,

analyzed: tathā api ayuktam prapañcasya bādhya tva abhāvāt
translated: even then it is incorrect, because the world is not contradicted.

analyzed: na tāvat saṃsāra avasthāyām āgamena bādhaḥ sambhavati iti uktam
translated: First, it has been said that contradiction by scripture is not possible in the state of worldly existence.

analyzed: muktasya tu bādhaka jñānam na āśaṅkanīyam eva pralīna sarva karaṇa tvāt
translated: But in the case of one who is liberated, the knowledge of contradiction cannot be suspected at all, because all the organs have dissolved away.

analyzed: karaṇa abhāve ca jñāna asambhavāt
translated: And when the organs are absent, knowledge is impossible.

analyzed: na ca a smaryamāṇasya prapañcasya abhāvaḥ śakyate pratyetum
translated: And the non-existence of the world, which is not remembered, cannot be known.

original: naca tasyāmavasthāyāṃ sambhavati smaraṇamaṃ sarvasaṃskārāṇāmucchinnatvāt tasmānna bādhasambhavaḥ //
analyzed: na ca tasyām avasthāyām sambhavati smaraṇam am sarva saṃskārāṇām ucchinna tvāt tasmāt na bādha sambhavaḥ
translated: And in that state, memory is not possible, because all impressions have ceased. Therefore, contradiction is not possible.

analyzed: yat ca avidyā kṛtaḥ yam prapañcaḥ iti
translated: And that this world is created by ignorance.

original: sā kasya na brahmaṇastasya svacchavidyārūpatvāt /🔽nahi bhāskare timirasyāvakāśaḥ sambhavati /
analyzed: sā kasya na brahmaṇaḥ tasya svaccha vidyā rūpa tvāt  nahi bhāskare timirasya avakāśaḥ sambhavati
translated: That belongs to Brahman, not to anyone else, because He is of the nature of pure knowledge.🔽For darkness has no place in the sun.

analyzed: na ca jīvānām
translated: And it does not belong to the individual souls.

original: teṣāṃ brahmātirekeṇābāvāt bhrāntyabhāvādeva ca tatkāraṇabhūtaṃ vastvantaramapyanupapannameva /
analyzed: teṣām brahma atirekeṇa abāvāt bhrānti abhāvāt eva ca tad kāraṇa bhūtam vastu antaram api anupapannam eva
translated: Because they do not exist apart from Brahman, and because of the absence of error itself, any other entity that could be the cause of that is also impossible.

analyzed: brahma atirekeṇa bhrānti jñānam tad kāraṇam ca api upagacchatām advaita hāniḥ
translated: For those who accept the knowledge of difference and its cause apart from Brahman, non-duality is lost.

analyzed: tat kiṅkṛtā ca brahmaṇaḥ vidyā
translated: Then, what is the knowledge of Brahman?

analyzed: na hi kāraṇa antaram asti
translated: For there is no other cause.

analyzed: svābhāvikī iti ced katham vidyā svabhāvam avidyā svabhāvam syāt
translated: If it is said to be natural, how can the nature of knowledge be the nature of ignorance?

analyzed: svābhāvika tve ca asyāḥ kena vināśaḥ syāt
